ealth programmes:  a practical guide
Workplans
A workplan should reflect the direction of the organization
and the strategies to be employed to move in that direction.  Itshould show all the activities that should be performed, whois responsible for carrying them out and the timetable.
An example of a workplan is found on p.25.
Monitoring
Monitoring keeps track of the programme activities.
Well-planned and systematic monitoring can provide
good information on whether the activities are movingin
